alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 5:38PM CDT until July 14 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Kansas and northeast Kansas, including the following counties, in east central Kansas, Douglas. In northeast Kansas, Jefferson. * WHEN...Until 830 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 538 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lawrence, Oskaloosa, Perry, McLouth, Ozawkie, Lecompton and Williamstown.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
